item.description: From the back of the box: Wheel and deal your way to a fortune even faster using debit cards instead of cash! All it takes is a card swipe for money to change hands. Now you can collect rent, buy properties and pay fines -- all with the touch of a button! It's a new way to play the family classic that's been brought up-to-date with higher property values and Taiwan's hot spots.

from Publisher blurb

Sorry Sliders Pocket Game - Aim, slide and score your way to victory! Set out the double-sided discs and slide your pawns to hit just the right mark. But watch out your opponent could knock you out of your perfect spot! Hit the points zones to start racking them up and avoid the danger zones, where your score could slide down to zero. Test your skill on the easy side of the discs first and then flip them over for an even bigger challenge! When your game is done, pack up your pawns and discs into the carry-case and take your sliding skills on the go.

Sorry Sliders Pocket Game includes:
6 pawns
5 Double-sided play-discs
Carry-case
Instructions

item.description:
“There is no doubt that the simultaneous deaths of the personal doctor of the Empire’s ambassador to the City of Gnomes, a dwarven merchant named Nuñez y Carazil, who owned a canton in Amidawa, and Timur ibn Sallah, an astonian burglar serving a sentence in the Morning City have not occurred by pure chance. As we will show here, though nothing obvious points to that conclusion, the three were acquaintances and exchanged coded letters often. Whoever decided to eliminate them, not only learned of this connection, but also had the resources to strike in three different places of the Universe at once. We know then, that we are dealing with two covert organisations: one to which the deceased belonged to, and another which performed the executions. We also know that at least one of them does not stop short of murder.
- Aldobrandino di Gato Nero, “The Chronicle of the War of Shadows”

CrystalicuM - Krzysztalowa Gra Karciana (Polish for Crystal Card Game, abbreviated KGK) is a Polish CCG, set in a 'fantasy/ space opera/ steampunk' universe and with anime/manga like art. The universe is also developed in a Polish role-playing game of the same name.

In the Known Universe there are many secret conflicts, wars and alliances. Secret brotherhoods fight each other, and for them, interstellar powers are only a tokens in the eternal game. The fate of the Universe and its unaware inhabitants rests upon you.

The Second Edition started in november 2010.

item.description:
"Politburo, Lucha de Poder" (Politburo, Power Struggle) is an ironic card game about the struggle happened after the Russian Revolution of 1917, to become the General Secretary of the Communist Party and guide the URRS into a new era.

Players try to guide their three candidates in a dangerous ascension against the Politburo charges, with the aim of become the General Secretary of the Communist Party. The players have to play diferent kind of cards to increase their candidates loyality and health and to decrease their opponents ones.

Players can enjoy role playing their candidate's actions (that results from the cards played), ruining the plans of the other candidates and for example calling them names like "antisovietic" or "traitor" at the same time that you use difamation cards to reduce your opponents loyality and maybe to send them into a Siberian Gulag. You can also use agresion cards to reduce their life points until you kill them.

Everithing is allowed to become the General Secretary of the Party.

item.description: Tabletop space combat game. Rules involve miniatures, tape measures, a decent amount of space in which to play, and other typical miniatures-based game stuff. From the publisher's page: "150 million years ago, the Surakari launched a surprise attack on the Heragul Empire. In a matter of a few weeks, half a dozen star systems had fallen to the Surakari. Now, the Minex system has come under attack. These seven planets provide critical fuel and material resources for the Heragul Empire. The Minex system must be defended at all costs. This is where the war really begins."

User summary:

The adventure of Hayabusa is a co-operative card game for 1–4 players. The space probe Hayabusa has just fetched samples from another planet and is journeying back to Earth, when trouble after trouble occurs. The players play the roles of the crew and the mission is to overcome the problems and guide Hayabusa back to the Earth safely. All players draw cards from the same deck, and discuss which cards to add to the deck, all the while problem cards are gradually added to the deck.

Designed by Makoto Nakamura, the designer of Gashbell the Card Battle.

Miniature game recreating a buoy race with flying/hovering vehicles (like the ones featured in Wip3out videogame, or Podracers from Star Wars Episode I). Vehicles can be equipped with weapons, and victory coul be achieved by being the fastest racer, or the last one still in game.

It was published on #3 of french magazine Ravage (February/March 2001).

Escaping the T-Rex

From the back of thebox:
A hungry T-Rex tracked down a small Dromaesaurus and since he runs a lot faster then the small Dromaesaurus, they have to be more clever then him to escape. A cooperative game to train the concentration.

Each player gets a hand of cards.
Players add to the track if they have matching cards to move the Dromaesaurus, all matching cards in their hands are played on their turn adding cards to the track. If they don't have matching cards they can ask 1 other player if they have the other card of the pair.
The T-Rex is moved by rolling a 0-1-2 dice. Since the T-Rex starts on a T-Rex only part of the track he is a bit behind, but if he is lucky he can catch up on the Dromaesaurus and win the game. If the Dromaesaurus is not caught when all cards are played the game is won by the players.

Components:
12 T-Rex route cards
40 escape cards
2 playing pieces with stands
1 0-1-2 dice

The game is part of the T-RexWorld line of Die Spiegelburg.

item.description:
Wargames Rules for Entire Battles. From Earliest History to 1400 AD.

A miniatures game for ancient and medieval warfare. The rules use interesting game mechanics, such as random movement rates, to represent the variable nature of warfare in the era it addresses.

Units are rated by a Unit Cohesion Value (UCV) that takes into account the armor, leadership, and training of the unit. For example, Roman legionaries would have a high UCV due to their better equipment, good leadership, and regular training while barbarian tribesmen would have a lower UCV.

Combat is divided into shooting, impact, and melee. Unit's abilities are divided into strengths and weaknesses in these areas. For example, a barbarian unit may have a high impact value, meaning that they have a formidable first charge, but their value in an ensuing melee is less imposing.

The figure scales used for the game is 1:50 (one model figure representing 50 actual men) and the time scale is one turn equals approximately 60 minutes. The game attempts to allow entire ancient battles to be fought out in miniature on the tabletop.

At the time it was published, Milgamex' "Ancient Warfare" emerged as a potential rival to the popularity of WRG's "Wargames Rules for Ancient and Medieval Battles." However, they could not push WRG's rules out of the place they had gained in international competition play. The rules went through two printings, but by 1980, they were difficult to find in stores.

A dice game simulating the game of Baseball by using two dice. One die is the "Pitching" die, which has STRIKES, BALLS and HITS. The second die or "Batting" die (used when a HIT is rolled on the "Pitching" die) has FOUL, CAUGHT and HOMERUN on its faces.

From the back of the box: 
Polaritease is the unique vertical board game that has caught the attention of people around the world. By using the forces of magnetism, each player is presented with the opportunity to create a wide variety of game-winning strategies.

Polaritease comes complete with rules, a black and white set of positive and negative charged tokens, a triangular game board, and two stands for mounting in a vertical position.

From the rules:
The object of Polaritease is simple. If you remove your tokens from the board before your opponent, you win. This is done when each token is placed on the bottom row, advanced to the red holes and then removed.

"What is this? A prodigy? A collective hallucination? This is not a movie. This is not a child’s play. This is not even the real world, as you’ve known it until now, at least...This is more".

For fifteen years players had to customize their own deck: now, at last, they can customize their cards too!

Prodigy Game Cards is a card game, you don't collect it, proper for experienced players; every player drives a group of people "special" in it: these people are called WIPper, in specific places around the world, that in order to prevail on the adversaries fight for many purposes.

These characters, at first sight, seem just common people, but possess increased ability that we called "prodigies." It is a WIPper who succeeds in these "prodigies". Who is not able to do it, is without bond. Four types of bond exist and each is represented, in the game, by a different color:

Molecular - yellow: those people that can modify their phisical structure and their molecular density in different ways.
Elementary - green: they possess the ability to channel, to send forth and to check different types of energy using the body as catalyst.
Feral - red: they possess a combination of Dna human and animal, that allow them to possess animal physical powers.
Psionic - blue: they are the WIPpers that possess some superior mental abilities.

To play a game of Prodigy Game Cards it needs at least two players. Every player must possess WIPper (the protagonists of our history), Places (where they fight) and a deck of Prodigies (the special actions that are able to do).

With Prodigy Game Cards you can directly reach a new level of personalization: the Prodigies have the technology Scracth&Play, developed in collaboration with Cartamundi, that allows the players to personalize, in phase of construction of the deck, every single paper.

Every Prodigy possesses three levels of power: low, middle and high. 
According to the strategy and experience, and according to the objective that the player want to get during the game, he decides what value "to release." To increase a low value, is necessary to remove the patina that covers the left yellow panel of the paper; to increase the value, without going to far, it is recommended the panel (orange) found to the center; if you need values of maximum power, it needs to set the right the panel (red) free.

name.value: Match!: hvordan ser du din verden?

item.description:
The game is so far only in danish...
But the rules are simple:

In the game Match! you have to explain why pictures are alike. You have to convince the other players, that your match is the best, but thats not enough. You also have to appreciate another players good explanation!

Yo get point for best match (most votes) and for appreciating the best match. The first player woth 20 points is the winner.

In Danish:

Match! - hvordan ser du din verden?
I match! skal du forklare, hvordan billeder af verden hænger sammen. Det kræver hverken terninger eller paratviden, det handler om at fortælle de gode historier - og at værdsætte de andres!

Reglerne kort fortalt:
Hver spiller får tre billeder på hånden. På bordet lægges et tilfældigt billeder, det er dette billede, de skal forsøge at 'matche'.
I hver runde vælger spillerne det billedkort fra hånden, som han/hun synes passer bedst med det kort, der i forvejen ligger på bordet. Spilleren forklarer eller fortæller en historie om hvorfor netop dette kort passer bedst – altså er det bedste Match! Alt gælder, så det gælder bare om at lade fantasien løbe.

Når alle spillere har lagt deres billedkort ned og fortalt deres historie, er det tid til afstemningen. Her stemmes der om hvem der har fortalt den bedste historie. Det er tilladt at stemme på sig selv.

Den spiller der har fået flest stemmer og dermed fortalt den bedste historie får 1 point. Alle de spillere, der har stemt på den spiller der fik flest stemmer, får hver 3 point. Det gælder altså ikke kun om at kunne fortælle den bedste historie, men også om at kunne anerkende en god historie fortalt af en anden...

Når der er fundet en afgørelse, lægges det vindende billedkort på bordet, ved siden af det kort der lige er fundet match til. Dette er nu det nye kort, der skal matches. Efterhånden i spillet kommer der altså en længere sammenhæng af billeder, tænk lige over det!

Spillerne får nye billeder i stedet for de brugtem og en ny runde starter.

Specialrunder. Hver spiller har desuden et 'specialrundekort', som kan ændre rundens form, når det spilles. F.eks. at der denne runde ikke må siges noget...

Pointene er ringe, der sættes på hver spillers pointtårn. Når en spiller har tårnet fyldt op, har han/hun vundet. Tillykke!

Source: summary from the rules + papskubber.dk

You are a survivor of a zombie apocalypse and you're stuck in a house with a broken car and hordes of zombies are attacking in the lawn. But wait, you found tools enough to fix the car to escape from the hordes of zombies. ARE YOU READY FOR IT?

Escape of the Dead is a solo game. In the game you are trying to fix the car while trying to defend yourself against hordes of zombies. You're given 4 Action dice per turn, distribute between 3 sections of the game (either by shooting zombie, fixing the barricade and/or fixing the car). Roll for success on each section. Any zombie that survived will attack the barricade. When you successfully killed 10 zombies you will be rewarded with power-up. You lose when your barricade is down (i.e barricade's hp equals zero). You win when the car is fixed 100% and get out of the house.

All you need to play

 1 A4 paper to print the board + rule
 4 six sided dice
 a pencil (optional)
 an eraser (optional)




As of 1.5 (The 'portable edition'), all you need to play

 1 A4/Letter paper to print the rules
 1 A4/Letter cardstock to print the cards/zombies
 4 six sided dice
 4 transparent card sleeves (optional)
 1 Dry Erase Marker/Grease Pencil (optional)
 Something to erase markings (optional)
 Gaming Stones (or some other marker) instead of Dry Erase/Grease Pencil. The amount you use is by preference. You will need from 3-30. 12 is ideal (1 for a zombie kill track, 1 for repair track, and 10 for barricade HP - You could make the barricade damage a track and only require 3 markers).




You can download the game for FREE in the file/download section below.

You can also visit us and play more games at http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/

item.description:
Bombs Away is a simple game of magnetic planes that drop ball bearing bombs on targets.

The aim of the game is to pick up metal ball bearings from the side of the board with your "magnet" plane, then try to fly the plane across the plastic covering — with the plane on top of the plastic and the ball hanging below it — and aim to drop the bomb onto one of the targets below. Each target gives a different score, and the player with the highest score wins.

Terror War is a DTP solitaire, strategy level game of the current conflict against al Qaeda and various potential adversaries. The player takes the side of the U.S./West and must choose one of the offered strategies. Operations include military, diplomatic, and intelligence. Economics have been added and interleaved as an important factor.

Initial strategy in the Historic game is set and one must follow through with it until allowed to change strategy. This presents both opportunity and difficulty. Terror operations are governed by Random Event and various rules. While the terror side may not seem too active, it's very existence constitutes a tremendous threat to the U.S./Western position in the world. Players will feel the pressure and frustration of achieving the right balance of strategy to means. A half dozen or so different strategies are available to play with.

The game spans 20 one-year turns, from 2001 to 2021. By the end of this time the U.S. side must either bring off a victory, or lose.

This is a tough, strange war and the game reflects that reality.

Download rules, map, counters, etc at http://talk.consimworld.com/WebX?14@153.EuETbiw6OXw.45@.1dd43f4f/0
Players have to answer trivia questions of different categories. A pawn moving around on a board shows which category. The first player to answer 10 questions correct wins the game.

From the rules:

In the mid 18th century, two fearless pirate brothers ruled the seas of the world as it was then known. They were Captain Blackbeard and the Red Corsair. 
They salvaged treasures, attacked merchant ships and embarked on many an adventure. Over the years, the par assembled loyal crews and had magic pirate spells which they used to spread terror and fear throughout the civilised world. They were as thick as thieves. As for who was the strongest of the two, no one knew. To decide those once and for all, each pirate kidnapped the beloved lady of the other.
In this exciting duel between two legendary figures, the players take on the roles of Captain Blackbeard and the Red Corsair and each attempt to free their ladies from the clutches of their brother.
The table where the cards are laid represents the sea and its islands. The hand of each player represents their pirate ship, while the cards symbolise the crew or the pirate spells. Which pirate brother will be the first to free his lady from the grasp of his brother?

Object of the game:
The object of the game is to free your pirate lady from the clutches of your opponent pirate.
The first player whose lady (Lady in Red for the Red Corsair, Lady in Black for Captain Blackbeard) appears on the opponent's discard pile is the winner.
Cards land on the discard pile either by defeating them while fighting on an isle or due to a penalty when the opponent pirates controle one or more of the 4 islands. Care has to be taken on which island your followers should be send as even the strongest pirate has its weaknesses. Furthermore, every island has its own penalties (e.g. discard cards from your hand / discard pile or pirates already on islands) which should be considered.

This is an adult themed game in which the goal is to use cards and directions in race to disrobe your "opponent." Each turn the two players are vying to control the title "Bedmaster," which gives them control of that round.

This is a dexterity game where players have to try and balance food items on the two trays held by a waiter. What makes this a game is that the waiter's feet are not flat, they're rounded, so any addtion to the trays causes the whole mass to move about.

The loser is the person who causes the food to fall off the trays.

Several versions of the battle have been produced. Each has been contrived to show a historic resolution, fun for the English player, depressing for the French. Azincourt (French spelling) is a unique approach. The French might have had more coordinated leadership. They might not have been so intent on an easy victory, and as a result been so careless. They might have taken advantage of the vulnerable English advance. They might have waited for the English to wear themselves out crossing the muddy field and allowed Henry to make the first attack. They might have employed their crossbows to better effect. Had they better control of their troops, crowded conditions would not have reduced combat effectiveness. Finally, had they considered avenues for retreating units, disruption of fresh units would not been such a problem.

In Azincourt I address a number of these what-ifs but, moreover, I offer players the unique mechanic of commanding one flank of each opposing army. In effect players play BOTH the French AND the British. It works out much better than you would expect. Since the English line is necessarily pretty static, there is little problem in coordinating an English defense while splitting command of the French in the face of the enemy mirrors the historically poor French command.

Azincourt is a card assisted, counter and hex game utilizing large colorful counters and a variety of aids that allows for a key battle component which other versions neglect to emphasize - the capture of nobles for ransom. Integral to Azincourt play is the capture of these nobles, English and French (including King Henry), of varying value. Ah and then there are the complications that such nobles bring. Wounded nobles become easy targets. Captured nobles make targets of their captors. Then there are Henry's terrible archers ... who WILL run out of arrows, and then what? To add to the game's variety is a random set-up and reinforcemnt schedule that toys with a number of possible historical possibilities.

Playtesting has been a blast so far but continues so no publisher has yet committed. Still, all in good time...

name.value: Do You Know Where You Are?: World Challenge Edition

item.description: Geography Trivia game where players are given a latitude and a longitude and a short clue and must guess the location. Play to a set number of points or any given time length. Includes 3000 questions on 500 cards.

In an era of global communication’s transformation, which will be the strategy that will grant a greater number of readers?

Our editorial strategy will prefer to publish newspaper like the metropolitan one's, specialized or the more traditional newspaper?
Our News will be published?

In the game the players will play both as Journalist that as newbie Editor.

On one side they will demand some news, on the other they will need to write some of that or write their own.
Once obtained enough news they will be able to publish their own newspaper.
Both the publication of the news, than the writings of them will grant a grown of popularity of the readers. Who will be the most famous? Who will have more readers?

At their turn the player can make 1 or 2 different action after having draw two News Cards:

1) Draw another News Card
2) Play a News Card on the board, asking with this action the writings of a news.
3) Play N different News Cards so that the sum will reach or will be higher of the value of the News on the board, Writing with this action the required news. This action will grant a number of readers both to the Journalist that write the article, than to the Editor that put the card on the board. The News Card will be earned from the Editor
4) Play a Newspaper Card using the News Card obtained from the action 3. This action will grant a number of readers to the player that has done it.

The game ends when a player had played 3 Newspaper Cards or had obtained 12 News Cards

The player with the most readers is the winner.

This is a funny party game that every player wears a headband, and puts a play card which illustrates an egg on the headband. Player must not look at his own card, that means everyone doesn't know the egg on his own head but can see other's eggs. You need to guess what your egg is according to other's actions.

In each turn, the eggs of some players will be broken, and the eggs of some other players would hatch successfully. You need to protect your egg from be broken.

The player who firstly hatches ten eggs will be the winner. It's not just funny during this process, but also contest of your mentality and deduction ability.

item.description:
Players are the candidates to be the new "God of Luck". By rolling dices, players try to complete various tasks to raise his Fu-Chi, which means good fortune. Players also can employ many Chinese traditional immortals to help himself. The player who earns the most Fu-Chi will become the new "God of Luck".

User Summary:

On each turn, player rolls a specific number of dices, if the result of some dices match the requirement of a hand card, which also calls Fu-Chi card, then the player could play that card from hand into his playing area. Player may discard some Fu-Chi cards from his area to invite an immortal to join him. Pick that immortal character card into his playing area. All of immortals have some special abilities to affect the result of rolling dices, such as seem 2 as 4, or just simply increase the volume of dice pool.

When someone owns 8 immortals, or 2 stacks of Fu-Chi cards have been drawn, the game will enter the final turn after the current turn. In the final turn, player has to do one's best to match the requirement of their hand cards, he cannot invite any immortals in the final turn, but can use the abilities of those invited immortals in the previous turns in his area. After the final turn, any Fu-Chi cards and immortal character cards in one's area would be scored as their illustration. The player with most scores (Fu-Chi) will become the new "God of Luck".

This game is made for World Cup 2010 South Africa. As a chief coach, you need to guess your opponent's thoughts, and apply your tactics carefully to defeat others.

In this game, player acts as the chief coach of one or several teams. Every team has its own skills. Player needs to apply these skills and tactic cards, which express the strategy of the team, to have matches with other teams. When a player controls several teams, he has to decide how to distribute his tactic cards for these teams in order to win the final champion. The result of a match will be decided by several dices, however, the number of dice may be influenced by tactic cards and team skills.

A climbing game played with a standard 52 card deck primarily meant for three players, (though there is a four player variant). It is similar to "Fight the Landlord" (Dou Di Zhu) but with some noticeable differences - the biggest being that the 3 (not the 2) is the high card, but also in the number of cards in the pot and allowable plays. Because the runs are relatively limited (4 through K only) and because there are no "bombs" it is a bit more predictable in its gameplay than Dou Di Zhu.

Each round starts with dealing the cards (except for four of them) and an auction for the remaining cards. The winner of the auction then picks up the cards and plays against the other two opponents who are now in a temporary partnership.

The goal for each round is to shed your cards. The winning bidder needs to shed all his cards first before one of the opposing players sheds all of their cards. Allowable plays are singles, pairs, triplets, quads and runs of three+ cards and staircases of three+ sets (note that runs/staircases may only involve 4's through K's). There are no "bombs".

If the high bidder wins, then the other players pay him the amount of points bid, and if the high bidder loses, then the each of the other players are paid the amount of points bid. Online implementations of the game generally play for a predetermined number of rounds and the individual player with the most points at the end of the last round is considered the winner.

Trivia game. Players take turns being the quizmaster and picks up the top card from the deck. First person to answer the question correctly gets to keep the card, if they miss the quizmaster keeps the card.

Each question has 3 answers to choose from.

Sample questions:

What is measured by a barometer? 
air pressure 
heat 
the humidity

When iron rusts its weight becomes... ?
heavier
lighter
remains the same

Includes 110 double sided cards and instructions

This is a climbing game that has the rare status as being regarded as good for 2 players. It uses a 48 card deck, with three 2's and one Ace removed. Like Big Two or Tien Len, the 2 is high, Ace's next, and the remaining cards normal down to three.

Allowable plays are singles, pairs, triplets, runs singles (5+ cards), consecutive pairs or triplets (2+ sets), full house (triplet+pair), and bombs (four of a kind plus an additional card, except for aces, where its a triplet plus an additional card).

The game is played for points - you get as many points as are remaining in your opponent's hand, unless he is holding 16, 15, or 14 cards, in which case you would just get 50, 40, or 30 points (respectively). A typical threshold for winning the game is 60 points.

(from the designer:)

Soldiers of the Rising Sun (SRS) is a simulation of warfare in the Pacific Theatre of Operations during World War Two.

Each Turn represents part of a day. Each military unit represents a company or platoon. Each section of track is one to three kilometers in length.

This is a counter and map simulation using a point-to-point movement and combat system.

It's envisaged that SRS will have a number of modules, each depicting a certain stage of the conflict in the PTO. These modules will be divided into a number of scenarios. Each scenario presents a challenge to both sides, with clear objectives which must be achieved in a limited number of turns.

The first module, Gathering Storm, focuses on the opening battles of the Kokoda Track Campaign.

Keep your savings up and expenses down as you compete to be the first to yell, "I’m debt free!" Don’t let your emergency fund go below $1,000. Plan for expenses using the envelope system. You don’t want to have too much month left at the end of your money. Spend, Save and Give through the income and expenses of everyday living. Dave Says cards keep the wisdom coming. Pay off debt using your debt snowball. Whether you’re an accountant, teacher or lawyer, no matter if you’re upside-down or right-side up, with Dave Ramsey’s Act Your Wage!, it’s fun to win with money. (Product Description from publisher's website.)

A race to get out of debt while moving around a board and dealing with events, including predictable repeating bills.

item.description:
INTRODUCTION:
Table Land is populated by humans, dwarfs, elves, orcs and barbarians. It is a world in permanent war for the control of the territory. Play and become a true Lord of Tierra Mesa by beating your rivals.

AIM OF THE GAME:
The aim of the game is to achieve, before the other players, a combination of 5 cards with the same value, or to form an army with 5 consecutive cards of the same race or where each value accords a different race (Unbeatable Run).

You will become Lord of Table Land in several ways:
1. Gathering together an army of 5 consecutive cards (run) of the same race.
2. Gathering together 5 cards of the same value (archers, princesses, catapults…)
3. And finally, the Unbeatable Run; you can get an army alliance gathering 5 consecutive cards of a different race each.

The winner is the player who gathers one of these combinations.

BEFORE THE GAME:
- Shuffle the cards.
- Hand out 5 cards to each player.
- Allocate the deck of cards facing down, in the middle of Table Land.
- The first game starts with the player who owns most hairs in his ears, continuing then, in a clockwise direction. The following games are started by the winner of the previous game.

Once all the cards have been distributed to the players the game stars. The player that starts the game draws one card from the central deck, looks at it, and gets rid of the card which is not convenient for him. Each player should always have 5 cards.

Each player discards should be placed on Table Land, ALWAYS in front of the player, creating a deck where the last discarded card is shown. This way there should be as many discarded decks as players.

When a player gets rid of a card and puts it on its deck facing up, any interested player can take it. How? The interested player should cover it with its hand. The fastest player covering the deck is the one that gets the card. This player should then discard one of his cards. Then, the game continues in a clockwise direction starting from him.

This way the game continues until one of the players gathers 5 cards with the same value or 5 consecutive cards of the same race or the Unbeatable Run. The player should let the other players know during his turn by placing the discard card facing down and by showing his 5 wining cards, he gains the victory by beating his rivals.

WINING COMBINATIONS:

Option 1 – Whoever wins 5 games is the winner of the whole game.

Option 2 – After each game all card points must be counted, except those from the winner, being 100 points those from the action cards. The player with fewer points after 5 games is the winner.

Option 3 – After each game only the winner’s points must be counted, in this situation the value (each value corresponds to a different race) of the Unbeatable Run is three times the addition of the values. The game finishes when one of the players reaches 1000 points or a previously agreed quantity.

These are not the only possibilities, players can agree on other options for victory.

ACTION CARDS:

This game has a series of action cards which are used for the interaction between players to threaten their rivals:

Skull (2 cards): If a player places this card on the other player’s deck it means that all his troops have been killed. He must place all his cards, facing down, beneath the central deck and draw 5 new cards.

card swap (1 card): If a player places this card in another player’s deck, both players must swap one card.

hand swap (1 card): Placing this card in another player’s discard deck means that you swap your hand of cards with that player.

steal 2 cards for the deck (2 cards): Placing this card on to other player’s discard deck means that the player who has placed the card (the attacking card) randomly takes 2 cards from the other player’s hand, and then this player must immediately pick up two new cards from the central deck. The 2 cards that have been taken from the player’s hand must be placed beneath the central deck without looking at them.

steal 3 cards for the deck (1 card): Placing this card in another player’s discard deck means that the player who has placed the card (the assailant) randomly takes 3 cards from his rival’s hand. Then, the rival should draw 3 new cards from the central deck. The cards taken from his hand must be placed beneath the central deck without looking at them.

steal a card (3 cards): Placing this card in another player’s discard deck means that the player who has placed the card (the assailant) randomly takes 1 card from his rival’s hand, and keeps it. Now the victim has 4 cards, therefore he must pick up a new card to have 5. The assailant has now 6 cards therefore he must discard one of them to have 5 again to continue the battle.

Potion (2 cards): the joker substitutes any other card concerning value and race. It can NOT be used as action card. One player can have on its hand up to two jokers.

FAQs:

- Which discard cards can I pick up? You can only pick up the last card that has been placed at the top of the discard deck from the player that’s on its turn.

- After an action card who continues? The player next to the player who has discarded the Action Card, always clockwise.

- Do runs or the Unbeatable Run have to start from number 5? Runs do not have to start from 5, as long as they are always consecutive numbers.

- What should it be done if the extension of Tierra Mesa cannot be cover and a player does not reach their rivals discard decks? Instead of hunting the card with the hand you should scream Guar!!! The one that screams it first takes the card.

- Can I draw one card from any discard deck while other player is drawing a card from the central deck? When a player picks up a card from the central deck the possibility of taking a card from a discard deck is blocked.

- If I take a card from a discard deck, can the card that appears underneath be taken later on? NO. Those cards were previously played, therefore, you should pay attention!!

- What should it be done when the central deck finishes? All discard decks from all the players must be gathered together to form a new central deck. The cards must be shuffle before placing them on the middle of Tierra Mesa.

- If two players place their hands on a discard deck, who takes the card? Either the one that has more fingers placed on it, or the most aggressive one.

item.description: Short for "San Luis Obispopoly", S.L.O.Poly markets itself as a Monopoly derivative, but actually has significant rules changes. Instead of the standard Monopoly board layout, the game has 45 properties. Each property costs $5,000, and the rent for each property is $1,000 times the number of properties next to it owned by the same player (so as more properties are owned in a row the rent goes up). Once all of the properties have been purchased from the bank, players can buy property chains from one another. The other major change is the concept of "marriage". When two players become land on the same square, they become married. Later, if you are married and land on your spouse's square, you sue for divorce and talk half of their property. If you are married and land on the single players square, the marriage gets annuled and the player gets sent to "Morrow Rock" (the game's equivalent to jail).

item.description:
Scruble Cube (Swedish and Finnish: Alfapet Twist) consists of a 4x4x4 Rubik's Cube, except a letter (along with the letter's point value) appears on each exposed side of each sub-cube. These letters are attached on circular pegs that freely rotate. This enables you to rotate each letter so that you can spell words in any direction.

Players have 90 seconds manipulate the cube to form a word in a straight line that may wrap around the cube. Other sub-cube faces have Scrabble-type point modifiers such as double letter score or tripe word score. You get to use these point modifiers if they appear at the beginning or end of your word. A variant allows you to use these modifiers to represent any letter. Players also score bonuses if their word covers more than one face and if it intersects a previously created word (and that word still appears on the cube).

From the web site of the game, http://www.scrublecube.com/:

If you can spell you can play ... SCRUBLE Cube!

What if you took some of the known playing patterns of some of the most popular word games and puzzles in history and combined them in a brand new, unique format to create the World’s Greatest 3-D Word Game? Well, you’d have the SCRUBLE Cube, a patent pending game with over 7.4 x 10^45 (that’s 7,401 septillion) possible configurations that anyone who can spell can play. And all in a portable format that can be played anywhere -- anytime. The SCRUBLE Cube is a word game and a puzzle -- on steroids!

It is all about getting to grandma's place. A traditional dice throwing board game with excitement caused by special fields. The players are moving on the board and come across different types of surprises, such as free ship trips or a broken car. The ultimate goal is to reach grandma's place before anyone else.

'Anything Goes' is a silly charades-type party game. On your turn, you draw two cards that tell you which two actions you have to present simultaneously. For example, you might end up "doing laundry" while "tight rope walking." All the other players write down guesses as to what you have acted out. After the players have written their guesses, the actor for the round reads all them of them out loud and gives an award to one player. The award category is chosen at random, and could be something like "funniest" or "strangest." It is not necessarily about correctly guessing what the actor presented. The player who collects the most awards wins the game.

When the lights go out and monsters come creeping, who is going to stop them? Monster Kids! These super powered teens are the only ones standing in the way of the monsters taking over the world. They sneak out at night to battle the fiends of darkness and get home before mom and dad find out!

Monster Kids is a fast paced, action card game. The players choose a character and work together to battle dangerous monsters. Players must use their cards carefully because the team wins, or loses, together! For those that don’t play well with others, you can play Monster Kids in versus mode battling to see who can defeat the most monsters. So whatever your taste, Monster Kids is sure to give you a monstrous, great time! - from the Official Nightstalker Games website.

King Solomon presided over a golden age of peace and prosperity in ancient Israel. During this time Solomon instituted an unprecedented building program. As one of Solomon's chief governors, you must procure materials and oversee construction of buildings and roads across the land for the glory of Solomon. You will also help to construct the Temple, one of the wonders of the ancient world.

Kingdom of Solomon is a worker-placement game with a few new twists and turns. Do you claim a resource space, an action space or throw in all your remaining pawns to grab a powerful Bonus Space? Will you spend your resources to extend Solomon's kingdom, take some points in the Market or add to the Temple? These and many other choices await you in this highly interactive game.

You play Kingdom of Solomon in rounds of four phases. You start the round placing your pawns to get resources, take actions or get a bonus. In this placement phase players take turns, each placing one pawn at a time. After all pawns have been placed, players resolve what they get from placing their pawns. This is called the resolution phase, and each player, in turn, resolves the placement of all their pawns before the next player. Next the players can go to the Market to sell or buy resources. In this market phase, like the placement phase, players alternate taking turns, except that players take turns in reverse order. The last shall be first, and the first shall be last. Finally, you build in the building phase. Players, one at a time, can build a building, roads and add blocks to the Temple.
 
When you place pawns to take actions, you can get an additional resource for a resource space, trade one resource for another, steal a resource from an opponent, get victory points or draw Fortune cards. You can play Fortune cards at any time. Fortune cards provide resources, victory points or special actions. Bonuses your pawns can gain for you include one of every resource, three Fortune cards or victory points with a rearrangement of turn order so you become the new first player.

You use resources to build things. Each thing costs a specific set of resources. The buildings you build give you victory points and additional spots to place pawns for resources or actions. Roads link resource spaces into resource regions so you can get more resources per pawn placed in the resource region. Building Temple blocks give you either victory points or temple tokens that help you gain or keep the High Priest. The High Priest lets you take advantage of another player’s resource region and gives you victory points at the end of the game.

The game ends at the end the round when a player places all his building tokens on building sites, there is a building token on each of the building sites, or the Temple is complete. The player with the most victory points wins.

The theme of the game is “going on adventure with Grandpa”

There are two decks of questions, one for adults and other for children. Before answer a question, the player must choose how many spaces he wants to move if the answer is correct. The winner is the player that reaches the last space and correctly answers the last question.

item.description: Detailed football simulation created and produced back in 1989 by an avid football fan. A two-player game, players make decisions about what plays to run on offense and defense like American Football. Like American Football, the winner is the player who successfully scores the most points via touchdowns and field-goals. The game comes with a special count-down timer to be used for the game clock and the play clock, and is used to help determine penalties or substitutions. Only a handful of copies of the game were created.

Educational board game 'Ekosystem" is designed for high school students of grade VIII which are familiar with ecology. Purpose of this game is to help students revise information about ecology.

Game box includes: 12 tiles with questions and tasks, chart with correct answers, 4 pawns and a dice.

Game is played by 4 players. They randomly choose pawns' colours and thus are assigned names: green – producer, blue – primary consumer(herbivore), red – secondary consumer(carnivore), black – decomposer(saprotroph). Green pawn moves first, next is blue, then red, and black last. Players move their pawns on the board by the number of fields indicated by the dice.

The are 12 marked fields on the board. Whenever a player's pawn steps on any of those fields he takes a questions and tasks tile with the number of field he stepped onto. He has to read a question or task aloud an immediately answer it. Illustrations near the board's edge might help. Answer is then checked with the chart.

The winner is the player who acquires the most points. For every correct answer player is awarded 3 points. Bonus for track completion: 1st place – 3 points, 2nd place – 2 points, 3rd place – 1 point. For incorrect answers players have to skip a turn. If there are any unanswered questions behind the last pawn, players that have reached finish line can try to answer them.

ShadowSea is a miniatures skirmish game set in a lost world full of fantasy creatures and archaic magic. The world is being explored by Humans who have recently discovered it.

In the game players use approximately 5-10 miniatures to represent their warband and there are several scenarios that give goals to each player such as capturing an artifact.

ShadowSea is a stand alone game, but uses a modified version of the Song of Blades and Heroes rules as its basis. Like Song of Blades and Heroes, this game uses short, medium and long measuring sticks rather than measurement in inches or centimeters. Also, six sided dice are used for determining action points available and resolving combat. ShadowSea adds an expanded magic system, equipment rules, rules for resolving non-combat actions, and new special abilities to the basic Song of Blades and Heroes rules.

item.description:
Exodus: Aufstieg und Fall (Rise and Fall) is a light 4x game. The players take control over an intergalactic race and have to explore the universe, expand their Empire, build trading routes and send ressources to the matching planets and attack trading routes and planets of the other players.

Exodus is played with 2-4 players on a random hex-board. Each player builds an unique deck of 60-80 cards (out of 8 different types of cards). During the game the empires rise and each player desides, when he wants to fall to get victory points. The the player builds up a new Empire with a different starting planet. To conquer a planet, the player have to build an outpost and get influence on this planet (depends on the number of possible ouposts on this planet). Each time he get influence, surrounding planets with other players outposts will also get influence-tokens. 
Each planet needs one out of four ressources to get victory points . To get the right ressources to the matching planet a player has to trade with the Galactic Senat, other players or move ressources through the trading routes. At the end of the turn each player bids on a special Senat-action for the next turn.
If a player counquers a planet, he'll get a special action each turn, but can't play as many cards as before. So each planet makes the players game more static and predictable.

Depending on the deck a player chooses, each player tries to get victory points through conquering, producing, attacking or trading or a mix of these types.

Dust is a real-time post nuclear role-playing game without a gamemaster. Each player creates an unique character with different abilities und items. 
The mission book shows the setup of the scenario and the time until the mission failed (1-4 days, 24 minutes playtime per day).

Each player uses sandtimers to determinate the action he'll use. Every opponent has a small sheet with his abilities and actions he'll do, if a player interacts with the NPC.
The players have to suceed the main mission, but can always accept secondary missions to get extra experience and items or money.

The game Azad is based on Ian M. Banks novel "the player of games".
Each player tries to get civilisation points with his tribes by building villages, towns and a metropolis. Each tribe has to earn ressources to support the villages and build new tribes.
Depending on the area the tribe moves, the attributes (power, movement, ressources) of each tribe changes and each player has to take a look at the enemy tribes and defend their own territory, before they take control of your ressources and cities.

In Bra$ilis, most of the citizen that come to politics try to take advantage of their position with schemes, make some extra money and raise in status and power. What move Bra$ilis is the power, in this game you will be able to feel that power.
Each player takes roll of a politic that has as a main objective obtain the majority of votes.
And for that, every move counts!! Make partnerships, create intrigues, lie and make a fool of other politics... in resume, everything you find in politics! Run away from scandals and corruption and try, at max, help (or trick) the population for more votes.

In each turn, players reveal a card/news containing three atributes: votes, image and money. Each of this political news will be disputed by the players according to their strategy. Players have a set of cards in their hands and place their political influence and power in front of them or in front of the other players, when they think their participation is enought they can chose to 'pass'. The politician that cointains the higher value of political power in front of him by the time everyone has passed is considered the autor of that scandal published and recieve all the information displayed in the card.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game accumulates more votes.

In the path to the victory, the administration of your image and money are essentials! With money you can buy political help, hiring a lawyer, marketeer or even a advertiser.
Your image, despite being the first tie-braker, will help you gain more or less cards during the game. But beware! The population is not watching the corruption quietly, there is a scale for their 'angryness' and they can start a revolution at any time!!



 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 


Em Bra$ilis, os cidadãos que entram para a vida pública querem, quase sempre, se aproveitar dos diversos esquemas e falcatruas e, com isso, faturar uma graninha extra e de quebra um pouco de poder e status. Afinal o que move Bra$ilis é o Poder e, nesse jogo, você poderá experimentar esse poder...
Cada jogador será um político de Bra$ilis que fará de tudo para, ao final do jogo, obter o maior número de votos possíveis e, assim, obter maior poder político. Mas não pense que isso é tarefa fácil, pois todos estarão brigando pelo mesmo objetivo e a população estará de olho no que acontece no Planalto.
E nessa hora vale tudo!! Alianças, intrigas, trapaças, acusações falsas, manipulações... Enfim, tudo que existe na política! Fuja dos escândalos de corrupção e tente, ao máximo, ajudar (ou enganar) a população para conseguir mais votos.

Source: Back of the box.

item.description:
Over one hundred years ago, L. Frank Baum introduced the world to the wondrous Land of Oz. Now, experience these familiar characters, fantastic locations, and disturbing creatures as never before imagined.

The Card Game of Oz introduces an innovative new game system called the Storyline Game System™ that adds strategy to your challenging and fun adventures through Oz. Each player takes on the role of an author attempting to construct the best story in the world of Oz. During the game, players will attempt to bring together objects, characters and locations that are appropriate together – for example, the Tin Woodman and his Oil Can – while avoiding hazards like the field of poppies and terrible beasts and villains like the Kalidahs or the Wicked Witch of the West.

Each round players roll a special set of dice to determine the number of points they have for drawing and playing cards. The number of dice increases during the game, allowing the game to scale naturally while you play. The game ends when a player is able to move a Prime character – that is, one of the main characters of the story – from her Title card all the way to The End, but doing so is no simple race because the character who triggers the endgame is worth no points toward victory.

Featuring hundreds of fascinating characters, events, and vistas, Oz is a world that has stood the test of time. Construct an iconic tale that is all your own!

item.description:
The Ancient Greek world is a backwater. Greek speaking cities are under constant threat. The great Persian Empire to the East, pirates in the seas, barbarians to the north, legends of terrible monsters haunting the land, bitter feuding kings, and incessant corruption plague the ancient Greek world.

Though from this fire rises greatness; warriors of legend, leaders whose names will be ingrained in history, pioneering inventors, and a city that may yet be the cradle of the future.

In Golden Age players take on the roles of the leaders of emerging city-states in the ancient Greek world. Beset from all sides, they must put away their differences if they are to weather the coming storm. Will you work together with your fellow Greek to grow, nurture and protect your world? Or will you be a zealous hegemon and write your own history? Either way Greece must stand to see the dawning of a new age or there will be no tomorrow.

This is a rule book for miniature wargames in the Napoleonic period. The book contains the rules, tables and charts needed to recreate battles in the Napoleonic era. The book is written by Leon Tucker.

Card game for 2 Players. One player is the Americans. The other player is the Taliban. 2006-2010+ Simulation of the ongoing conflict in Afghanistan following the Taliban resurgence after the US led Invasion in 2001. Players recruit allies and steal or neutralize their opponents allies. The player with the most points worth of allies at the end of the game wins. Action and Event cards modify attacks and card play. Every Ally has a special ability that gives you an edge in the conflict. Influence tokens are used to recruit Allies as well as draw extra cards and get extra attacks.

Prêt-à-Porter is an economic strategy game set in a world of fashion. Players run clothes companies and fight for dominance during fashion shows. It is – perhaps – one of the most cruel and ruthless of all our games. Money can be a dangerous weapon.

During the game players open new branches and outlets, hire new workers and try to gain new capabilities. New Design Agencies, Brand stores or Preparation rooms are opened, Accountants, Models and Designers are hired, lucrative contracts are signed to allow for short-term profits and expand company’s competencies.

Every single month player’s company gains new capabilities.

Each quarter held fashion shows – each player has to prepare a collection of clothing and has to show it on the show. The public, media, experts estimate collections in four categories and award prizes and diplomas. The more awards (represented by ‘stars’ in the game) will be collected at the show, the more money the players earn for selling their collection!

Will you get award for best Trends? Will you manage to be best in Public Relations and get the Media award? Will you earn more ‘stars’ than your opponent?

If you win ‘stars’, your opponents don’t.
If you win ‘stars’, you earn more money. Your opponents don’t.
If you win ‘stars’, you earn money, you hire new stuff, you get better. Your opponents don’t.

That is why during show you will kill for every single ‘star’. Welcome to the hell…


Prêt-à-Porter is a 2-4 player board game, unique mix of deep economy strategy and direct interaction. Low luck element, many important decisions to be made and many strategies that can be used to acclaim victory. With wide range of different employees, different buildings and contracts you can create your unique company every single time.

item.description:
Topologic is a game of logic and deduction, but also uses piece movement.

Every game is played over two rounds. In the first round one player plays the role of the referee (who hides a secret), the other the role of the seekers. In the second round the roles reverse.

The 5 seekers are moved across the playing field (an assembled area of connected Nestortiles). Then the referee counts the score of the currently occupied locations (1 point for a color and/or number match) and announces the sum of the scored points. As they get more information, the seekers can deduce where the secret is hidden.

Topologic is abstract, but players are encouraged to come up with a thematic background they like. This even includes renaming the game for each session.

item.description:
Take It or Leave It is a game title asking to be mocked by those who don't like the design, so here's hoping it goes over well with audiences.

What is the game, you ask? Each player has a hand of four task cards showing dice combinations and other tasks that the player is trying to achieve during a game round, such as a sum of pips less than 13, or two white dice and one black die; each card has a point value on it, with the tougher cards obviously being worth more points. Someone rolls a bunch of white, black and red dice, then players take turns choosing a die from the pool. Each player also holds one action card that lets him manipulate the dice to better achieve his tasks.

On a turn, a player either takes a die or passes from the round. Once everyone has passed, players assign dice to their task cards, with red dice counting as either black or white. Complete your tasks, and you'll cheer (and score points); have dice unused, and you'll wish that you'd never been born – or you'll just lose a couple of points. Depends on how much of a drama queen you are.

After each round, a player refills his hand of cards in the appropriate proportions, and after each player has started a round 1-3 times (depending on the number of players), the game ends and players tally their points.

item.description:
Manufacture is an economic simulation game where players compete in variant aspects of the manufacturing process. Their decisions concern the production cost (setup, materials purchases, wages, rents), the sales (volume and value), the cash flow, the research of new products and optimization of current production, the financing of their actions, etc.

These tough economic decisions are being unfold over a factory layout where the positiong of the different modules is also important. The manufacturing process involves different stages of processing, routing and the efficient worker allocation.

There are 3 different types of goods (raw materials, intermediate goods and final goods) which are traded between the players and the outer world (in all directions) via contracts or a free market.

Rabbit is a cooperative game for 1-2 players.
(from the website)
 It is Spring and You are the leader of a herd of rabbits that needs to recover if it is to survive the next Winter. Your herd was once over twenty strong but disease and predators have brought you down to your last four rabbits. To make matters worse, humans and their machines have been approaching and your warren may be in grave danger.
 To win the game, you must have 12 or more Rabbits in play at the end of the last turn. Each game consists of 37 turns representing the weeks between Spring and Winter. You will need to make efficient use of your rabbits' abilities to Collect Food, Produce New Rabbits, and Explore New Areas if your herd is to survive.
 The challenge in Rabbit comes not from competition with other players but from the game itself. Rabbit can be enjoyed as a 1 player game or as a cooperative 2 player game. ( in a 2 player game, 1 player controls the Thinker and the other player controls Scouts and Fighters )

A Sri Lankan race game for two players. It has elements of Ludo-type games, in as much that you both start with three men and you win by getting all three 'home'. The board is unusual, in that it is not a 'circle', rather it is a track of 31 spaces, with some spaces marked as castles and you are safe from being sent home on them.

item.description:
1865 Sardinia is a board game belonging to the 18xx series for 2-4 players and set on the Sardinia island (and Corsica).

Players play the role of 19th century entrepreneurs investing in the construction as well as the financial and operational management of railways. Selling and buying shares on the stock market, seeking new sources of funding, laying track and placing stations, running trains and paying dividends are all basic elements of 18xx games.

In addition, 1865 Sardinia has several features that make it different from other 18xx titles. The most important distinctions are:

 a traffic based system that makes calculating company's revenues easier and faster
 foreign investors (Dragons) trade in certificates in addition to human players
 an absorption mechanism that allows companies to acquire each other




Other interesting points:

 before phase 5, all companies start as minor companies with 40%/20%/20%/20% shares
 converting a company from minor to major requires a direct route from a company base to a historical destination city
 private companies become 2 trains when transferred to a company and also provide extra traffic
 buying trains from bank makes the share price jump up
 the last 2, 3, and 4 train comes with a discount
 withholding money in company doesn't reduce the share price
 tiles can be replaced with another tile of same color, provided the current connections are retained
 bankrupt players are given enough loans to keep them in game, loans are then deducted from final score in the end




				
					Dragons


 during stock rounds, the Dragons will also trade
 each stock round begins with a Dragon and Dragons also play between each player
 dragons are interested in company's rank, an indicator based on the sum of trains phase and tokens on board, followed on a special table on the board
 dragons will immediately sell certificates in companies ranked red and will buy certificates ranked green, according to a fairly simple and consistent algorithm.
 players can buy shares from Dragons, but must pay a premium for well-ranked shares
 share prices are adjusted down when shares are sold by Dragons or the company president


				
					Traffic system


 when a company places a station marker, it gets to collect traffic chips from the board along the route
 mines also produce traffic chips, but diminish in value as the game proceeds
 each traffic chip is worth $10 in revenue
 revenues are the smaller value of total revenue in traffic chips and train capacity available
 phase 2 trains, for example, have 8 capacity each, so if company has two of those for 16 capacity and 14 traffic chips, it will make $140 in revenue, while adding three chips would increase the revenue to $160 because the capacity hits the roof at that point

item.description:
From the Wired.Com review of The Goonies 25th Anniversary Edition DVD Set:

".... the set’s true treasure - a special Goonies-themed board game.

The bulk of the box set’s real estate is devoted to this game, and immediately upon cracking open the shrink wrap you are taken by its diminutive size. Still, if The Goonies taught us anything it’s that size doesn’t always matter, and I’m happy to report that this is the case here. Though the board itself is only about half the size of your average game, it’s actually a brilliantly colored fold-up printed on super sturdy laminated stock that appears perfectly capable of standing up to multiple years’ worth of play sessions. The same can be said for the game’s Move Cards which, while not quite as brawny as most CCG cards, are thick enough to get the job done.

Gameplay is fairly simple and properly reflects the spirit of the source materials - players take the role of one of five Goonies (Mikey, Data, Mouth, Chunk or Andy) and use a three-card hand in an attempt to escape One-Eyed Willy’s cave. Players disarm traps to collect Gold Doubloons, and the first to reach the "Escape" square with three such Doubloons wins the game. The process is complicated by a trio of tricky Skull Spaces (only one of which contains the necessary key) that must be passed to reach the exit. This is balanced out by a fun selection of Special Move Cards that allow players to switch places with or steal gold from opponents. While certainly not the most engaging board game experience in movie fandom, it does manage to channel the proper amount of nostalgia and charm in a small but effective package."

item.description: A dexterity game that is a combination of regular pool and Tic-Tac-Toe. Each player has five balls that they shoot into the nine holes in the middle of the board, trying to form three in a row. The winner of a round is the first to pocket three in a row or pocket all 5 of their balls (each worth 1 point). Should a player pocket all 5 balls and form two rows that is worth 3 points. A game is to a mutually agreed total of points. Pocketed balls remain as obstacles on the board, making further shots more difficult. In the "easy" game you flick the balls directly. The "medium" game is also direct flicking, but balls must rebound or be the result of a combination to be pocketed. In the "professional" game you use a blue "cue" ball, which introduces more strategic options such as safety play.

item.description:
Sea Ranger is a new type of game, where learning is entertaining and family fun. The world's oceans our are largest single resource. If they are abused, mis-managed or ignored; we on land will be worse off for our neglect of this wonderful planet.

Sea Ranger can teach or remind us all of our place in this world; how we use the oceans and waterways; the balance of life and our needs; raise our awareness of how mankind neglects or abuses these incredible places.

Within, on and around our oceans and rivers, hide a multitude of life, living in a state of balance, growing and evolving. Mankind is upsetting this balance to dangerous levels.

Learn, have fun with friends and family, share this knowledge and make a difference in this world.

What is Sea Ranger?

Sea Ranger is a board game designed to educate and entertain 2-6 players about the amazing and diverse wildlife that inhabits the oceans and waterways creating a giant circle of life. We can also learn how mankind uses and abuses this incredible resource we all share.

Sea Ranger is a multi-facetted game. Not only are the players learning about the aquatic environment, they are also learning about themselves. Players learn many qualities of character that are required to either win or prevent collective loss among the players. They share the responsibilities, successes and benefits.

Players learn:;

To share and care for resources.

Collective and individual responsibility.

Manage resources.

To maintain a balance of life and needs.

Value life in all forms as part of the wealth of this world.

Respect each players participation and support.

The best part is that it is fun doing this.

Who Can Play?

The game is aimed at children from 8 years and over and adults. Children will require guidance to assemble.

Children quickly master the rules.

So how does it all work?

The game gives players knowledge and choices. Players can easily discern what feels right or is the right thing to do. We all know within our hearts what is right and good, even if we don't know the answer.

The game uses a special board and tokens. You print out the board and pieces on your colour printer, then cut and assemble the components. To make them last longer or be more durable you may mount them on card or laminate the pieces. Teach the children skills as they read instructions and learn to cut out the pieces.

The game is directed by a special card deck which will present players with a series of events and choices. The players must decide how they will resolve these, sometimes this may require teamwork and sharing. There are many different strategies you can use to win, some can be very quick, others slower.

Part of the game revolves around maintaining the circle of life, ensuring a balance of species to enable life to continue. Each creature is part of that circle and has a unique role to play.

Players must then try and balance mankind's intervention and damage to the seas and waterways. It is a careful juggling act; players individually cannot hope to keep the balance so you need to play cooperatively.

What Do I Get?

Sea Ranger is 26-page colour PDF plus a small rules booklet. The game requires you to print 16-pages to create the board, cards & tokens. Included is the deluxe card set giving you the choice of finish. Where possible we have tried to minimise the graphical content to save ink. Ideally the major components are printed on card. Some simple assembly is required.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)

"Calling all Ninja! Lord Garmadon is on a mission: collect all four Golden Weapons of Spinjitzu and, ultimately, rule the world. Can you stop him?"

NinjaGo is a game made out of LEGO bricks.

The playing pieces are LEGO mini figure on a “spinjitzu” spinning disk. Each figure should be armed with one weapon.

Each player then spins the figures so they collide. You win by knocking the other playing piece over, and the take the defeated warrior’s weapon.

You can also play cards that will enchant your warrior.

There is a base set that can be expanded by adding more ninjas and skeleton warriors.

Tribal Dice is a unique new solitaire and interactive multiplayer game where players use eight dice with eight sides (8d8) in various colors. The dice represent tribal spirits that must be restored in an ancient ritual to save the tribe and determine the new chieftain. A spirit is fully restored when it shows the highest number, and when it shows that number, each one grants the player a different special power that can be invoked one time to influence the other dice in the game. Players can also re-roll matching dice.

Victory is predicated on strategic planning for which dice to re-roll, when and what order to invoke special powers, and some luck. The solitaire game provides a score, whether won or lost, that a player can attempt to improve over successive games. The multiplayer game has an adjustible game length and a high level of interaction.

Although current electronic implementations of the game allow only solitaire and three player multiplayer, it is possible to play with any number of players, and a special "chaos rule" allows for large groups to play the game without any downtime, as they can invoke their special powers out of turn order.

item.description:
Seduxion - The game of dice that melts the Ice

The game comes with 8 differnt dice and a scoring pad along with a small rule sheet.

Each of the dice have one face with Lips, Serpents, Apples, fig leaves and Cupids on them. The 6th face contains one letter of the word SEDUXION. 5 of the dice are black the 3 red dice which have the letters S,E,X on it are red. (This combination scores a special bonus)

In turn each player throws all 8 dice and may leave down any, none, or all the dice thrown. Up to 3 rolls are permitted per turn. You get points for more than 3 of the same symbols or have more than 7 differnt faces shown and for making words with at least 3 letters

Example: After 3 rolls you got: 4 Cupids and D, I, E, X. This counts 5 points for the 4 Cupids and 10 points for the word DIE, a total of 15 points. The word SEX gots a special bonus of 30 points.

Every field on the score sheet can be used only once, like in Yatzee. You have to cross out the field on the score sheet. After ten turns one column is finished and the points are calculated together. The games ends here or goes up for 2 other columns on the same score sheet. The winner of a column gets a 50 point bonus.

Should you get SEDUXION at any time this will ends the game and you win the game. In a 3 column game the winner takes a 100 point bonus and all other lose their point on that column.

(from the rules and user summary)

In the dark depths of a drifting space wreck, a small team of specialists investigates unusual scanner readings of life on board. The team acts relaxed; banter hides their anxiety. Motion scanners show nothing; torches illuminate the dank corridor casting long shadows.

Suddenly the point man's scanner shows movement ahead, increasing in speed. His reflexes are conditioned by experience, so he shoulders the carbine. The torch illuminates a horrific shape. Recognising danger the point man fires the carbine in a rapid series of bursts.

An alien screeches of pain and the creature falls to the ground. You have just made first contact.

More motion scanners come to life, movement all around you starts closing in through the maze of ship's corridors. This is more than five men can handle. It is time to withdraw back to the assault shuttle.

What is The Gauntlet?

The Gauntlet is a print 'n play board game for 1-6 players. Designed as an entertaining tactical-action and strategy game, the game is based around teaching leadership concepts and team work.

Players are tasked with a simple mission, get the team to safety. Players choose their leaders and role within the team, each team character has unique skills or abilities which can be used to advantage by the team and individual. The teams leader guides the play of the game, allowing the individuals to create team work to support each other.

The play is fast and furious, players quickly mastering the simple mechanics designed to focus the players on making decisions than working out how to play. Within minutes players will be talking, making decisions and blasting aliens.

The game is over in 35 turns or 45 minutes, whichever comes first.

The Gauntlet is even suitable for solo play.

What do I get?

The game is available in a downloadable PDF format. You have the choice as to how the game will be printed and presented to fit your needs. The game includes;

+ a complete full colour board detailing a section of the space ship.

+ stand-up counters for the humans and aliens.

+ 3d components (containers, boxes and rubble).

+ optional 3d components to create the walls and structure of the space ship.

+ a complete rules guide with examples of play.

+ a guide to assembly.

Not included are six (6) regular six-sided dice (the game can be played with less, six being the ideal).

The game may be produced with the minimal components or with option 3d componentry that creates an incredible game board that gives the game an incredible look and feel.

You can print the game on your own colour printer or have it proffessionally printed by a 3rd party printing service. A heavy card stock of around 200gsm is reccommended. The board could be printed on full page label stock. In either case they can be mounted on very heavy cardboard, wood sheets or even foam boards.

Assembly is quick and easy.

(Edutainment Games, www.edutainment-games.com)

This is a memory-game for the very young. 10 stars cover 5 picture pairs in the sky. The first player picks up two stars and if the pictures underneath are the same the stars are kept. If not, the stars go back into the sky. Then the second player picks up two stars, etc. Who will collect the most stars? To play a NEW game there is the possibility to change the picture-plates underneath, fitting the colors, around the holes in the corners, to the same colors of the pegs. There are two plates, printed on both sides, that give four different possibilities. To add even more playing possibilities, there are 5 papers included for drawing, or gluing pictures or photos. 
To practice before playing memo, you can start with a simple game, where you look for each pair. One picture is covered with a star, who will find the same picture?

Each player gets a set of acrobats (1 through 5). The objective is to stack the acrobats one on top of the other (from 1 to 5).

Throwing the die; the highest throw starts. Each player throws the die until they get a 1, then a 2 and so on to stack the 5 acrobats. A player who throws a 6 loses a turn. If the stack of acrobats falls, the player will have to start again from 1. (source from the directions on the box)

item.description:
Patton’s First Victory is an all-new echelon of wargame, providing a simple, yet accurate, simulation of World War II’s Tunisian campaign and featuring a mere four pages of rules that elegantly recreate the battles fought between Allied and Axis forces.
In addition to its simplicity, Patton’s First Victory is marvelously accurate, featuring the full order of battle of historic divisions that were engaged during the struggle for Tunisia, as well as allotments of “support assets” that can be assigned to those divisions to increase their combat strength. Should the Axis player assign his few support assets to his best divisions to form powerful strike groups, or should he use them to augment his light units desperately defending the ridges?
Patton’s First Victory portrays all the elements of the actual campaign. The terrain is historically accurate; every town and airbase is precisely correct, and every unit is rated with precise combat factors. You will see why the 10th Panzer Division was so formidable, and how Patton was able to defeat the vestige of the famed Afrikakorps.
The entire Tunisian campaign can be played in a couple hours, yet Patton’s First Victory remains a game requiring operational skill. The Allied player must maintain the momentum and keep pressure on the Axis, fighting for a breakthrough to capture enough of the important Tunisian harbors to win the game. The Axis player must manage his scant yet potent army and air force to repel the attacking Allies, all the while watching for opportunities to counterattack and throw the throw them back in disarray.
Patton’s First Victory is a quick and easy game of the 1943 campaign between Allied and Axis forces in North Africa during World War II. It’s spring 1943; the Allies have arrived to liberate Tunisia from the Axis, but the Axis soldiers are experienced and commanded by some of the best generals of the war. If Axis forces can hold on in the Tunisian mountains, they can delay the progress of the war in the west indefinitely. If the Allies can capture the Tunisian harbors, they will cut off the Axis from all supply and escape.

Game Contents:
17 x 22 (43 x 56 cm) terrain map
114 die-cut counters
One Rules booklet for this series

The Everlasting Glory (è‹±çƒˆåƒç§‹) is the first independent box wargame made by Formosa Force Games. It is a two-player operational wargame simulates the War of Resistance (æŠ—æˆ°ï¼‰1937-45.
